summary: Email correspondence between attorney Jack Scarola and federal prosecutors regarding a victim of Jeffrey Epstein who was willing to speak to investigators. Scarola provides information about the victim's abuse and gifts received from Epstein, and prosecutors inquire about arranging a meeting.

persons.name: Jack Scarola
persons.context: Attorney who sends an email to federal prosecutors providing information about a victim of Jeffrey Epstein and indicating the victim's willingness to speak with investigators.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of a pending prosecution; accused of repeatedly molesting a victim in Florida beginning when she was 14 years old.

persons.name: Robert C. Josefsberg
persons.context: Copied on the email from Jack Scarola to federal prosecutors regarding the Epstein case.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Copied on the email from Jack Scarola to federal prosecutors regarding the Epstein case.

connections.description: Scarola is providing information to prosecutors about Epstein's victim as part of the pending prosecution against Epstein.
Epstein repeatedly molested the victim in Florida beginning when she was 14 years old and sent her multiple gifts of lingerie.
Both are attorneys copied on the email correspondence regarding the Epstein case.
Both are attorneys copied on the email correspondence regarding the Epstein case.

events.title: Email Correspondence Regarding Epstein Victim
events.description: Attorney Jack Scarola emails federal prosecutors with information about a victim of Jeffrey Epstein who is willing to speak to investigators, detailing abuse and gifts received.

keyFacts: A victim of Jeffrey Epstein was repeatedly molested in Florida beginning at age 14.
The victim received multiple gifts of lingerie from Epstein shipped to her in Florida from New York.
The victim was willing to speak to investigators as of August 2019.
Federal prosecutors were actively trying to contact the victim and were willing to travel to Florida to meet with her.
